result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Shimko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees. You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob J Shimko in court with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF88, 14CM104, 13CF97.  Time set for sentencing hearing.  Court in session -2:00 pm.

Court goes over plea agreement with the DE.  Court questions DE.  Court goes over the DE's rights.  DE understands his rights.  Willett agrees that his client understands his rights and the elements.  No read in charges from the State.

DE pleads, 14CF58 - ct1 NC, ct2 NC, 14CF88 - NC, 14CM104, NC.  Repeater enhancer dismissed.  All other counts not spoken of shall be dismissed.

Court will find DE guilty.  State thinks that DE has 302 days credit.  DE states he knows he has more than that.  DE makes statement to the court.  State thinks the DE should be in drug court.  Court goes over what the DE should have for a credit, 356 days.  Court tells DE more about drug court.  Court will accept the recommendation of the parties.

13CF97, 4 yrs in state prison with 1 yr initial confinement, 3 yrs ex supervision, financial obligation shall become civil judgment.

14CF58, withhold sentence place on probation for 3 yrs, ct 2 amended to misdemeanor.  Pay court costs.  Repeater enhancer dismissed.

14CF88, Amend to criminal charge to misdemeanor.

14CM104, repeater enhancer dismissed.

3 misdemeanor counts, probation for 1 year, concurrent.

Defendant Jacob J Shimko in court with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Defendant Jacob J Shimko in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM104, 13CF87, 14CF88-arraignment/waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG.  Set for dispositve motions within 10 days after receiving discovery.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond.  $5000.00 sign bond, must be employed to get out of jail. DE must remain employed or return to jail.  DE must check in the jail on a daily basis.  NO ALCOHOL POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION.  DO NOT BE ANYWHERE OR GO ANYWHERE ALCOHOL IS PRESENT.   Set for 1-12-15 @ 10:00AM, RH.  DE must have physical scheduled, will be released on the current cash bond for physical appt.  Mother will transport to physical.  After employment is obtained the sign bond will go into effect.

Defendant Jacob J Shimko in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF88, 14CM104.  Waive reading of CC in 14CF58, 14CF88.  14CM104-waive reading of the CC, enter a plea of NG to misdemeanor counts. THE STATE WILL EXTRADITE. ENTER NATIONWIDE

Defendant Jacob J Shimko not in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not appear, Court files with the court an AOM, did receive mail returned.  Court will authorize a probable cause $1000.00 cash warrant, will extradite.
